title: Total Probability
text: By the definition of probability, the summation of the probabilities of all possible outcomes in a sample space must add up to $$1$$. We know that the possible outcomes here are $$1$$, $$2$$, $$3$$, $$4$$, $$5$$, and $$6$$. Therefore, their probabilities, P(1), P(2), P(3), P(4), P(5), and P(6) must add up to one. We can use subtraction from $$1$$ to calculate $$P(x=4)$$.
